Hello how can I unmount a diviser??: ah, right. How did you mount it?
how? Is it a usb disk or external device?
do you know what device it is?
Right. You need to remove the line in /etc/fstab that refers to it. But you need to be *very* careful to make sure you only change that line.
use 'sudo gedit /etc/fstab' to edit the file
Also, make sure it says 'vfat' on the line before you remove it.

right. now, that'll take care of the next boot. To unmount it this boot, make sure every folder you have open on that partition is closed, any files on the partition are closed and type 'sudo umount /dev/hda1'
